thread.title: What to watch in the Rugby World Cup semifinals
thread.title_full: What to watch in the Rugby World Cup semifinals

author: JOHN PYE
title: What to watch in the Rugby World Cup semifinals
text:
Christophe Ena What to watch in the Rugby World Cup semifinals 
South Africa's Bryan Habana arrives for a training session at Twickenham Stadium, London, Friday, Oct. 23, 2015. South Africa will play New Zealand's All Blacks in a Rugby World Cup semifinal match on Saturday. (AP Photo/Christophe Ena) Christophe Ena What to watch in the Rugby World Cup semifinals 
New Zealand's Julian Savea warms up during a training session in Sunbury-on-Thames, outside London, Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015. New Zealand's All Blacks will play South Africa in a Rugby World Cup semifinal match on Saturday. (AP Photo/Christophe Ena) Christophe Ena What to watch in the Rugby World Cup semifinals 
New Zealand's Daniel Carter, catches the ball during a training session in Sunbury-on-Thames, outside London, Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015. New Zealand's All Blacks will play South Africa in a Rugby World Cup semifinal match on Saturday. (AP Photo/Christophe Ena) Alastair Grant What to watch in the Rugby World Cup semifinals 
Argentina's head coach Daniel Hourcade, centre talks to his players during a training session at Bagshot, England, Friday, Oct. 23, 2015. Argentina play Australia in a Rugby World Cup semifinal at Twickenham, Sunday. (AP Photo/Alastair Grant) Frank Augstein What to watch in the Rugby World Cup semifinals 
Australia’s coach Michael Cheika gestures on the pitch before the Rugby World Cup quarterfinal match between Australia and Scotland at Twickenham Stadium, London, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. (AP Photo/Frank Augstein) Frank Augstein What to watch in the Rugby World Cup semifinals 
Australia's captain Stephen Moore is tackled by Scotland's John Hardie during the Rugby World Cup quarterfinal match between Australia and Scotland at Twickenham Stadium, London, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. (AP Photo/Frank Augstein) Posted: Friday, October 23, 2015 12:09 pm What to watch in the Rugby World Cup semifinals Associated Press | 
LONDON (AP) — The Rugby World Cup has boiled down to a contest between the four teams from the Rugby Championship, the annual competition between the sport's powerhouse teams in the southern hemisphere. 
It's the first time that all four semifinalists have come from the same hemisphere, and the southerly breeze has caused some turbulence in Europe.
